experiment_info.name: center_spread_parameterization
experiment_info.description: Parameterize 2-source as (center_x, center_y, spread_x, spread_y) instead of (x1, y1, x2, y2)
experiment_info.hypothesis: Center-spread removes permutation ambiguity, improving CMA-ES convergence

reason_aborted: PARAMETERIZATION CHANGES DON'T HELP. (1) polar_parameterization FAILED with -0.0216 score, +14.3 min. Quote: 'ABANDON the problem_reformulation family'. (2) Permutation ambiguity is NOT a problem - RMSE is symmetric in source ordering. (3) Scoring system already handles permutation invariance.

polar_parameterization.key_finding: Coordinate transformations hurt CMA-ES: 'CMA-ES covariance learns wrong correlations' and 'Bound clipping introduces discontinuities'

scoring_system.note: Permutation Invariance: Two source candidates with same source tuples in different orders are considered identical

cmaes_behavior.note: CMA-ES evaluates solutions by fitness (RMSE), not source labels. Both orderings give same RMSE - no ambiguity problem.

key_insight: Permutation ambiguity is NOT a problem for CMA-ES optimization because RMSE is symmetric in source ordering. The polar parameterization experiment proved coordinate transformations HURT performance. Center-spread would have similar issues: non-linear transformation, complex constraints, and CMA-ES learning inappropriate correlations.
